messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re:special needs haircuts
messages.msgSnippet: ... We had an angel of a hairdresser too. She used to cut Casey s hair while Casey snuggled against my chest with only one side of her head showing at a time.
messages.messageBody:
>>We also have a barber who is an absolute angel.>>

We had an angel of a hairdresser too. She used to cut Casey's hair while
Casey snuggled against my chest with only one side of her head showing at a
time. She even cut her hair while Casey was sleeping on me once. And the
hair cuts were good! We got compliments!

>>And it's definitely a case of do the best you can as quick as you can. We
>>rate our experiences in lollipops consumed. Our first experience was a
>>five. The last time was a reverent..... wow....only one lollipop>>

We used m&m's. ;-) I remember getting down on the floor in front of Casey
(once she would sit in the chair) so that she would look down. I kept
handing her one m&m at a time. That way the hairdresser could cut the hair
at the nape of her neck. Ahh..good times. lol

Life is good.
~Mary

messages.subject: Re:special needs haircuts
messages.msgSnippet: We also have a barber who is an absolute angel.  And it s definitely a case of do the best you can as quick as you can.  We rate our experiences in lollipops
messages.messageBody:
We also have a barber who is an absolute angel. And it's definitely a case
of do the best you can as quick as you can. We rate our experiences in
lollipops consumed. Our first experience was a five. The last time was a
reverent..... wow....only one lollipop.
Mary J
